results.title: The Cry for help
results.creator_credit: Louisiana Association for Mental Health, George C Stoney Associates and George C. Stoney
results.brief_description: A training film for police officers and law enforcement agencies; presenting some of the major causes of suicide and follows with consequential discussion on how to handle the suicidal person. Quite powerful and graphic for it’s time.

results.title: The Crusades: saints and sinners
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Victor Vicas
results.brief_description: Describes the first crusade, early in the 11th century, and the complex motives which led thousands of people to journey to the Holy Land. The climactic taking of Jerusalem is recreated, and the irony implicit in the concept of a holy war is examined.

results.title: The Crunch bird meets Kink Konk
results.creator_credit: Ted Petok and Crunch Bird Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Muppet Coffee Break”.
A short animated film about a bird who misinterprets his manager’s instructions to obtain some ping pong balls. The bird triumphantly returns to his boss with a surprise package after his heroic encounter with King Kong. NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN.

results.title: The Cruise of the Magi
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: Follows the cruise of the Co-operative Trading Society’s boat ‘The Magi’, along the coast of south east Papua among the Mailu Islands. Shows something of the boat’s trading activities and organisation of the Co-operative, the work of the Co-operative Officer employed by the government, and also aspects of native life.

results.title: The Cruise
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, ONF | NFB, John Hubley and Faith Hubley
results.brief_description: An animated film by John and Faith Hubley in which everything moves to music and where a juke box is the center of everything. It is a fable of our times, about people and numbers and chance, set on a cruise ship where everything is most correct until a maverick passenger decides to flout the rules. Animation by Phil Duncan, Gary Mooney and Les Drew. Music by Benny Carter.

results.title: The Cruickshank family
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Parker, Philip Robertson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
This film deals with the problems faced by the Cruickshank family living on the land - insecure employment, lack of constant medical benefits cover, and the need to continue in unpredictable work in a rural environment. They are aware of their own powerlessness against accident, sickness, and the economic forces governing their lives and they can only hope for the best.

results.title: The Crucifixion by Pablo Picasso, 1930
results.creator_credit: Marie de Mercey, Delta Image, RMN and La Sept
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
This program examines Picasso’s painting “The Crucifixion” painted in 1930. It was an unusual subject for the artist, given his indifference to religious themes, however evidence from his sketch books indicates that he was secretly drawn to this subject. The program analyses the painting in terms of its relationship to depictions of the Crucifixion over time, and in the context of the artist’s life and work. The troubled relationship he was experiencing with women, in particular his wife at that time is reflected in the figure of Christ.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marie de Mercey, Delta Image, RMN and La Sept

results.title: The Crucifixion
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: The camera studies, in close-up, the crucifixion scenes in silver bas relief by the artist Matcham Skipper. This film was photographed in St Mary’s Church, Ivanhoe, Victoria. In place of a narration, the soundtrack uses biblical quotations. Photographed by Giorgio Mangiamele.

results.title: The Crown of Thorns Story
results.creator_credit: Educational Information Service Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority and L Zann
results.brief_description: This video presents the most up to date report on the Crown of Thorns available in Australia today. The documentary tells the story of the Crown of Thorns on the Great barrier Reef. It traces the history of the infestations and what is now known about the starfish with special emphasis on the research currently underway.

results.title: The Crow road
results.creator_credit: Bradley Adams, British Broadcasting Corporation, Union Pictures Productions and Calvin Miller
results.brief_description: Rory McHoan was last seen on his way to visit his brother, Kenneth, seven years ago. No trace of him was ever found despite an exhaustive police investigation. Inspired by his grandmother, Rory’s nephew, Prentice, takes on the task of finding Rory, and uncovering the truth about his missing uncle’s disappearance. With only Rory’s archaic and unreadable computer disks, pages of a novel-in-progress, and a ghost at his shoulders, Prentice must make a long journey with discoveries to be made about himself before he can unravel the dark secrets that lie buried in his family’s history. Based on a novel by Iain Banks. Cast includes: Joseph McFadden, Bill Paterson and Valerie Edmond.
